00014 #include <openct/ifd.h>
00015 
00016 struct pollfd; /* for poll_presence */
00017 
00018 /* Types of devices supported by libifd */
00019 enum {
00020         IFD_DEVICE_TYPE_SERIAL = 0,
00021         IFD_DEVICE_TYPE_USB,
00022         IFD_DEVICE_TYPE_PS2,
00023         IFD_DEVICE_TYPE_PCMCIA,
00024         IFD_DEVICE_TYPE_OTHER,
00025 };
00026 
00027 union ifd_device_params {
00028         struct {
00029                 unsigned int    speed;
00030                 int             bits;
00031                 int             stopbits;
00032                 int             parity;
00033                 int             check_parity;
00034                 unsigned int    rts : 1,
00035                                 dtr : 1;
00036         } serial;
00037         struct {
00038                 int configuration;
00039                 int interface;
00040                 int altsetting;
00041                 int ep_o;
00042                 int ep_i;
00043                 int ep_intr;
00044         } usb;
00045 };
00046 
00047 enum {
00048         IFD_SERIAL_PARITY_NONE = 0,
00049         IFD_SERIAL_PARITY_ODD  = 1,
00050         IFD_SERIAL_PARITY_EVEN = 2,
00051 };
00052 #define IFD_SERIAL_PARITY_TOGGLE(n)     ((n)? ((n) ^ 3) : 0)
00053 
00054 #define IFD_MAX_DEVID_PARTS     5
00055 typedef struct ifd_devid {
00056         int             type;
00057         unsigned int    num;
00058         unsigned int    val[IFD_MAX_DEVID_PARTS];
00059 } ifd_devid_t;
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Control messages to be sent through
00063  * ifd_device_control must always have a guard word
00064  * that contains the device type.
00065  */
00066 enum {
00067         IFD_USB_URB_TYPE_ISO = 0,
00068         IFD_USB_URB_TYPE_INTERRUPT = 1,
00069         IFD_USB_URB_TYPE_CONTROL = 2,
00070         IFD_USB_URB_TYPE_BULK = 3,
00071 };
00072 typedef struct ifd_usb_capture ifd_usb_capture_t;
